sub_title: Lecturer / Scientist Chemistry at HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)
summary:
I am an experienced, practical and creative scientist (chemist), projectleader and lecturer. My strength is to identify the fundamental questions in applied projects and to translate fundamental knowledge into real, applied solutions that give a competitive edge. I enjoy solving puzzles where I can employ my strong analytical mind and experimental skills to translate application requirements into the development of novel, suitable materials. My experience in, and leading of, multidisciplinary R&D projects enables me to communicate effectively with researchers from other disciplines. As a mentor/coach and lecturer I support and empower co-workers and students in their own development.

I have over 15 years of experience at Philips Research, in various projects as senior scientist and later as project leader. Since 2011 I am also an assistant professor at Utrecht University.
An overview of these projects and activities in Philips and Utrecht can be found in my list of experience in my profile. The projects shared several activities and responsibilities, which are summarised here:
- Development of novel materials and devices for optical and electronic applications
- Project leading: planning, resource management, reporting to customers
- Coaching co-workers and mentoring students
- Generation of intellectual property (6 US patents granted, 19 pending)
- Initiating, maintaining and strengthening contacts with suppliers, customers and partners, as well as academic institutions, resulting in several collaborations
- Managing laboratory facilities & build-up/maintenance of measurement equipment and setups

Areas of expertise: organic chemistry, polymers, sustainability, colloid chemistry & physics, soft condensed matter, nanomaterials, quantum dots, co-ordination chemistry and homogeneous catalysis.

company.name: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)

profile_positions.company: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)
profile_positions.description:
Lecturer / Scientist Chemistry in the Institute for Life Science and Chemistry (ILC) at the HU. My responsibilities and activities include:
- teaching courses (practical and theoretical) in organic and polymer chemistry and R&D topics
- developing / co-ordinating new courses in the curriculum
- maintaining / strengthening the links with the business field, to improve our curriculum and match with business needs
- strenthening link between education and research at the HU, in collaboration with our lectorate, universities and business partners (e.g. by acquisition of student research projects)
- acquisition of research funding through project applications (1 Kiem GoChem awarded; participating in Interreg project)
- strengthening collaboration with other institutes at the HU
- chairman of the R&D teacher team
profile_positions.title: Lecturer / Scientist Chemistry

profile_positions.description:
Part-time assistant professor at Utrecht University in the Soft Condensed Matter group of  prof. Alfons van Blaaderen.
- Research on modifying optical properties (refractive index) of devices with responsive (electrophoretic) colloidal nanoparticle systems, aimed at switchable optical components (e.g. lenses). For this research I acquired external (STW) funding for a 2 PhD project, which started in February 2016.
- Self-assembly of emissive nanocrystals into functional superstructures (EU ETN PhD project with Gent University)
- Strengthening public/private co-operation (e.g. through joint projects)
- Mentoring undergraduate and PhD students
- Teaching: Nanomaterials Master course and Physics for Chemists bachelor course
profile_positions.title: Part-time Assistant Professor

profile_positions.description: Investigation into the Physics bachelor curriculum, with the aim to increase attractiveness for prospective students
profile_positions.title: Part-time education explorer

profile_positions.description:
Projectleader “Quantum Dots: IP Generation”: 
Expanding the Intellectual Property portfolio on quantum dots in solid state lighting applications. Smart packaging of quantum dots in various host matrices and embedding in larger particles to enable facile integration with LED light sources.
Collaboration with Delft University on cadmium-free giant quantum dots (joint STW project).
profile_positions.title: Senior Scientist & Projectleader

profile_positions.description:
Project “Qdots for Lighting”, in collaboration with Philips LumiLeds:
Developing quantum dots as narrow-band phosphors for solid state lighting applications. Improved miscibility of quantum dots in polymeric matrices after developing a deep understanding of the factors governing colloidal stability.
profile_positions.title: Senior Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Project “Oxidic Optoelectronics”:
Development and electro-optical characterisation of novel ZnO based phosphors with much improved visual emission, for use in large-area light sources. Build-up of electro-optical test setups.
profile_positions.title: Senior Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Project “Sustainable Materials Exploration”:
Study on improving sustainability of (scarce) electronic materials and products; introduction of Life Cycle Analysis evaluation in Philips Research.
profile_positions.title: Senior Scientist & Projectleader

profile_positions.description:
Project “Bright, Full-colour Reflective Electrophoretic Displays”: 
Development and characterisation of (non-aqueous) electrophoretic colloidal dispersions for use in in-plane switching (ips) electrophoretic displays, and developing prototype displays, aimed at full-colour e-paper. In this project we developed a world-first dual colour ips display prototype with only one active colloidal suspension containing a mix of different particles, which I developed. Initiated a joint development project with Kodak.
profile_positions.title: Senior Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Project “Plastic Electronics”: 
Study of stability aspects of polymer semiconductors for organic integrated circuits and the device physics thereof.
profile_positions.title: Senior Scientist

profile_positions.description: Postdoctoral research on synthesis, characterisation and reactivity of a new class of tetranuclear manganese-oxo ‘cubane’ clusters, as potential functional catalytic models for the water-oxidation complex in the Photosystem II enzyme.
profile_positions.title: Postdoc
